**The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the mid-to-late Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Supreme Clarity tradition. Contains sections such as *The Secret Taboo Names of the Great One*, *The Nine August Treasure Registers of the River Chart*, and *Essential Methods for Observing the Stars*. Two scrolls in total. Source of base text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart, Scroll One*

The mysterious masters and sagely artisans, transmitting from generation to generation, have sensed this flourishing age. When its radiance wanes and fades, the cycles of good and evil alternate—now declining, now rising; sinking, then reviving; severed, yet reconnecting. Arrogance and negligence forever sever good causes, while single-minded reverence and secrecy nurture the growth of virtue. Through virtue, one may perceive the Dao’s response, and where the response gathers, anomalies arise. Anomalies lead to communion with the divine, and divine masters bequeath sacred texts—secret graphs and essential writings—naturally manifesting to cleanse filth and dispel dust. Silent recognition and adherence bring longevity and transcendence, delivering the self and saving all beings. The Three Vehicles unfold in mutual exposition, neither the hidden nor the manifest discarded. Those who defy the Dao sink into ruin, and the suffering of ruin is grievous. Each should heed this warning, remaining vigilant to the end as at the beginning, for only then do they align with the Dao.

All natural true writings exist inherently in the void. Thus, they may soar or sink, conceal or reveal. Dragons, horses, tortoises, and fish bear the charts and images, all born from the beginningless, emerging in response to karmic resonance. Their manifestations vary, yet only virtue is their companion. Those who attain them come later, though the writings have long preceded them. What is obtained today is shared with those who receive them—all inscribed on jade and gold tablets, meticulously carved and secretly preserved. Mastery comes through recitation, memorization, and profound understanding. Through recitation and cultivation, one may also transcribe them in cinnabar on silk, wearing them on the body to guard against forgetfulness. In urgency, one may consult them, and their practice dispels calamities, averts misfortune, and extends blessings. With unwavering diligence over time, one ascends to the ranks of sagely transcendents.

Disciples must maintain purity and reverence when invoking the mysterious and petitioning the divine. These teachings must never be rashly transmitted to the unworthy, for reckless disclosure invites profound misfortune. All should exercise caution, upholding secrecy and adherence.

### *The Secret Taboo Names of the Great One (II)*

The Great One is the child of the Dao. When the Dao responds to the resonance of beings, it manifests the divine and generates the One. The One, through divine guidance, gives rise to and completes all things, boundless and infinite. For learners, the first step is to awaken and cultivate this, thereby attaining utmost authenticity. Authentic sages transmit it to guide later learners. Later learners, through compliance and awakening, unite with those who came before, and in this unity, they merge with the Dao.

The Three Powers, the Five Virtues, and the nine august numinous spirits arise from transformation and serve as the foundation for saving all beings. This Great One, the Three and Five, and the Nine Spirits are the ultimate source of the Dao. The One governs both the hidden and the manifest, serving as the origin of the formless. The Two represents the primordial exchange of qi, giving rise to Heaven, Earth, and Humanity. Humanity possesses varying degrees of acuity, and Heaven and Earth respond accordingly, forming three grades. Separation and union produce the Five, and the tripling of three yields the Nine, wherein all transformations are complete. Refining the insubstantial into the substantial, and penetrating the interrelation of being and non-being, all depends on the perfected person.

Humanity follows Earth, Earth follows Heaven, Heaven follows the Dao, and the Dao follows spontaneity. The Three Powers possess form and are capable of practicing the Dao. Through practicing the Dao to its ultimate end, one ascends to the level of spontaneity. Though their ranks differ, all share a single source. Thus, the spirit of the Great One is most revered and exalted, giving birth to Heaven and establishing Earth, and bringing forth all beings.

Those who do not receive the original source of the River Chart, do not wear the true graphs, do not recognize the primordial Great One, do not preserve the Five Spirits, do not uphold the Three Ones, and do not serve the Nine August Ones shall be unable to perform the Great Petition. The Great Petition’s invocations and supplications must encompass all directions. The most exalted and sacred taboo names, the hidden names of the inner spirits—without receiving them from a master, one must not rashly practice them. Practice should follow proper transmission, and transmission requires seeking a master. When the karmic conditions align to receive the text, one must adhere to the rites of the Mysterious Covenant.

Under the rites of the Mysterious Covenant, no one may arbitrarily perform any method or forcibly undertake its practice. Practicing it improperly incurs guilt, harming both oneself and others. Those who sincerely wish to practice must discreetly seek an enlightened master and obtain the rites of the Mysterious Covenant. Purify the heart and cleanse the self, and the encounter will occur naturally. Follow the precepts to prepare the petitions, and once the memorials are presented, perform the jiao offering with utmost sincerity. Be reverent and discreet, for violations invite investigation and punishment. Diligence and devotion over time bring blessings, and accumulated blessings cultivate virtue, which endures with the Dao.

The most revered spirit of the Great One has the taboo name *Wuyou Shou*, the style *Gui Huichang*, and alternate names *Jieming* and *Jipin*. Through the accumulation of virtuous causes, one may encounter these true taboo names. Silently recognize and inwardly preserve them, reciting them in secret during movement and stillness. Whatever one seeks or desires, focus the mind and direct the intention—yet one must not reveal them to others. If shared with the unworthy, both parties incur guilt. To avoid guilt and attain blessings, silently preserve them in the heart. Constantly visualize the radiant image of the Great One’s spirit, resplendent and extraordinary, by one’s side—whether sitting or walking, in leisure or urgency, day and night. Through unwavering contemplation, misfortune dissipates and fortune arrives. Over time, one may converse with the spirit, and speech and form will merge, becoming one.

Those unable to maintain constant visualization may focus on it at night, within the Sixfold Palace of the self. Enter between the eyebrows and retreat one inch to reach the Hall of Light; two inches to reach the Grotto Chamber. The Grotto Chamber lies to the south, the Hall of Light to the north—this is the Sixfold Palace, above which is the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. The Great One dwells in the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate by day and in the Sixfold Palace by night. Constantly preserving this practice brings daily renewal of merit and conduct, and demons dare not intrude. Without knowledge of the Great One, even virtuous deeds performed in vain will be corrupted by evil, and one’s cultivation will bear no fruit. For learners seeking accomplishment, preserving the One is of utmost urgency.

### *The Nine August Treasure Registers (III)*

**First:** The Yang Brightness Star, the Jade August Nine Dawn Lords. The Celestial Pivot Star—this is the spirit-soul of Yang Brightness. Opposite the northwest gate of Yang Brightness is the August Lady of the Supreme Realized Ones.

**Second:** The Yin Essence Star, the Jade August North Supreme Dawn Lord. The Celestial Rotation Star—this is the spirit-soul of Yin Essence. Opposite the west gate of Yin Essence is the August Lady of the Supreme Mystery.

**Third:** The Perfected Person Star, the Jade August Lord of Immortal Florescence. The Celestial Mechanism Star—this is the essence-spirit of the Perfected Person. Opposite the southeast gate of the Perfected Person is the Primordial August Lady.

**Fourth:** The Profound Darkness Star, the Jade August Lord of the Soaring Canopy. The Celestial Balance Star—this is the essence-spirit of Profound Darkness. Opposite the east gate of Profound Darkness is the August Lady of Florescence.

**Fifth:** The Cinnabar Prime Star, the Jade August Lord of the Seven Dawns of the Golden Bushel. The Jade Pivot Star—this is the essence-spirit of Cinnabar Prime. Opposite the northeast gate of Cinnabar Prime is the Median August Lady.

**Sixth:** The Northern Culmen Star, the Jade August Lord of the Flying Florescence of the North. The Kaiyang Star—this is the essence-spirit of the Northern Culmen. Opposite the north gate of the Northern Culmen is the August Lady of Dawn Florescence and Primordial Augustness.

**Seventh:** The Celestial Pass Star, the Jade August Lord of the Ninefold Prime and Northern Canopy. The Radiant Light Star—this is the luminous essence-spirit of the Celestial Pass. The south gate of the Celestial Pass faces downward toward the Northern Culmen, where the August Lady of the Numinous resides.

**Eighth:** The Auxiliary Star, the Jade August Lord of the Nine Dawns. The Cavernous Brightness Star—this is the essence-spirit of the Auxiliary Star, Yang Brightness. Opposite the west gate of the Auxiliary Star, above the Celestial Pass, is the August Lady of the Thearch.

**Ninth:** The Adjuvant Star, the Jade August Lord of the True Prime. The Hidden Prime Star—this is the luminous and empty essence-spirit of the Adjuvant Star. Opposite the southeast gate of the Adjuvant Star is the August Lady of the Supreme.

The Nine August Ones and Nine August Ladies correspond to and manifest through the stars, revealing subtleties by their radiance to guide the myriad branches back to the source. Though the ten thousand kinds are manifold, none depart from the Nine. Thus, they are ordered in sequence, with yin and yang paired in opposition.

For those who wish to visualize and wear the talismanic chart, make offerings, pay homage, meditate to perceive the true forms, and seek their desires, prepare a pure white silk half-scroll, one foot in width and one foot two inches in length. Use light blue for the base stars and light black for the essence-spirits. The attire and exhaled qi of the August Lords and Ladies should follow the annotations. The transmitted talismanic charts and texts worn by the master must not be inscribed; record them according to the preceding format as follows:

*Chart Title: [Year], [Month], [Day], [Hour] of the Great Year. [Province], [Commandery], [County], [Village], [Residence]. Male/Female, [Official Rank], [Name], age [Number], born in the year [Year Stem-Branch], month [Month], day [Day], with the [Nayin] of [Celestial Stem], affiliated with [Mountain] and [Star]. In [Province], [Commandery], [Village], [Mountain Forest], [Abode], from the master [Male/Female Perfected Person/Teacher’s Name], received the concealed names of the Nine August Ones, the formula for longevity and deathlessness, and the Nine Palaces’ numinous officials to guard the body, repel evil, and admit rectitude, assembling together before the Jade Thearch. No violation is permitted, as per the statutes of the Great Mysterious Capital.*

**Yang Brightness Grand Marshal’s Mansion:** Nine hundred twenty ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Yin Essence Grand Minister’s Mansion:** Five hundred fifty ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Perfected Person Controller of Destinies’ Mansion:** Seven hundred seventy ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Profound Darkness Mobile Strike Mansion:** Eight hundred ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Cinnabar Prime Dipper Lord’s Mansion:** Seven hundred twenty ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Northern Culmen Grand Constancy Mansion:** Seven hundred seventy ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Celestial Pass Supreme Thearch’s Mansion:** Nine hundred ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Auxiliary Heavenly Honored Jade Thearch’s Mansion:** Nine hundred ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

**Adjuvant Supreme Thearch True Minister’s Mansion:** Nine hundred ninety ranks, nine hundred million myriad numinous officials, flying dragon riders, embroidered-robed messengers, jade lads and jade maidens—ninety-nine hundred million myriad persons.

The talismans are to be inscribed in cinnabar.

**First, the Yang Brightness Star:** Heaven’s Grand Marshal, who rectifies and governs transgressions, oversees the Nine Heavens’ Perfected Ones above, supervises the Five Peaks’ flying immortals in the middle, and leads the Perfected Persons of later learners below, weighing the merits and faults of heaven, earth, spirits, and numina. Its domain spans nine hundred twenty *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Dipper’s True Abode in the Azure City, named Upper Numinous, with the style *Shaking Heaven’s Mallet*, wears a Nine Dawns Jade Crown, azure feathered flying robes, and holds the Mysterious Chart of the Dipper, seated within the jade tower. Those who know its inner name will be illuminated by the Jade Dawn and soar through the Great Void.

**Second, the Yin Essence Star:** Heaven’s Grand Minister, who governs emoluments and ranks, oversees the celestial lodges above and leads the myriad spirits below, as well as those who study immortality. Its domain spans five hundred fifty *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Five-Colored Jade Tower, the Lifting Bushel, titled the Northern Supreme Divine Lord, named *Nurturing Infant*, with the style *Stimulating Bright Light*, wears a Dark Essence Jade Crown, dark feathered flying robes, and holds a five-colored feathered tally.

**Third, the Perfected Person Star:** Heaven’s Minister of Works, who governs immortals and transcendents, oversees the Nine Heavens’ lofty Perfected Ones above, supervises the Five Peaks’ numinous immortals in the middle, and leads those who study the Dao below. Its domain spans seven hundred seventy *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Yellow Terrace Jade Tower, the Treading Dipper, titled the Divine Lord of Immortal Florescence, named *Returning to the Multitude*, with the style *Dwelling in Reverent Tread*, wears a Flying Dawn Treasure Crown, azure feathered flying robes, and holds the Azure Register of the Dipper’s Center.

**Fourth, the Profound Darkness Star:** Heaven’s Mobile Strike General, who punishes rebels, oversees the Nine Heavens’ ghosts and spirits above, commands the Northern Thearch’s Three Offices in the middle, and supervises the myriad multitudes below. Its domain spans eight hundred *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Vermilion Terrace Jade Tower, the Pacing Central Dipper, titled the August Lord of the Soaring Canopy of the Profound, named *Pivot of Darkness*, with the style *Shaking Heaven’s Pillar*, wears a Three Florescence Treasure Dawn Crown, cinnabar brocade flying robes, and holds the tally of life’s numina.

**Fifth, the Cinnabar Prime Star:** Heaven’s Dipper Lord, who oversees the registers of official rank and destiny. Above, he governs the myriad registers of the Nine Heavens; in the middle, he commands the ledgers of ghosts and spirits; below, he presides over the registers of those who study the Perfected and the destinies of the multitudes. None in the heavens or upon the earth escape his governance. Its domain spans seven hundred and twenty *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Plain Terrace Golden Tower, Treader of the Celestial Threads, titled the Golden Chief of the Seven Dawns Lord, named *Upper Opening*, with the style *Transforming the Five Paths*, wears a Seven Treasures Flying Heaven Crown, white brocade flying skirts, and holds the Azure Mystery Registers.

**Sixth, the Northern Culmen Star:** Heaven’s Grand Constancy, who oversees advancement. Above, he governs the Supreme Perfected of the Nine Heavens; in the middle, he commands the Flying Immortals of the Five Peaks; below, he presides over the ranks of scholars. Its domain spans seven hundred and seventy *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Mystic Terrace Jade Tower, Pacing the Celestial Web, titled the Northern Dawn Flying Splendor Lord, named *Bright Numen*, with the style *Prospering the Upper Prime*, wears a Flying Essence Splendor Crown, purple brocade flying robes, and holds the Jade Baton of the Dipper.

**Seventh, the Celestial Pass Star:** Heaven’s Supreme Thearch, who governs the mechanisms of heaven and earth, the length of the four seasons, and the cycles of prosperity, decline, and kalpas. Its domain spans nine hundred *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Nine-Tiered Jade Tower, Rider of the Dragon, titled the All-Numinous Nine Prime Northern Canopy Dawn Lord, named *Mystic Pivot*, with the style *Opening Heaven’s Path*, wears a Nine Prime Crown, nine-hued brocade robes, and holds the Radiant Spirit Baton.

**Eighth, the Auxiliary Stars:** The stars of the Heavenly Venerable Jade Thearch, the constant yang, who oversees the Flying Immortals. Above, he governs the Nine Heavens; below, he commands the Nine Earths, the divine officials of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways. Its domain spans nine hundred and ninety *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Purple Qi Jade Tower, Wanderer of the Three Destinies, titled the Thearch-Venerable Nine Dawns Lord, named *Essence of Constancy*, with the style *Empty Upper Opening, Upright Extension*, wears a Flying Essence Jade Crown, nine-hued phoenix robes, and holds the Fire Bell.

**Ninth, the Adjuvant Stars:** The stars of the Supreme Thearch Perfected Person, the hidden emptiness, who governs boundless transformations. Its domain spans nine hundred and ninety *li*, where the Perfected Person of the Jade Terrace Purple Cincture, Wanderer of the Three Yangs, titled the Thearch-Perfected Prime Dawn Lord, named *Dark Emptiness*, with the style *Mystic Yang Radiance, Dark and Vast*, wears a Flying Heaven Jade Crown, nine-dragon robes, and holds the Thearch’s Edict.

**First, the Celestial Pivot Star:** Within the Prime Dipper Palace dwells the Mystic Supreme Perfected August Lady, named *Bright Permeation*, with the style *Infant Nurturance*, whose true name is [omitted]. She wears a Flying Spirit Splendor topknot, a three-hued skirt of purple, yellow, and azure, and a sash with nine bells. Her mouth ever emits azure *qi*, its light pouring into the Yang Brightness Star.

Her mouth ever emits yellow *qi*, its light pouring into the Perfected Person Star.

She wears a seven-tiered jade crown and a crimson phoenix-patterned robe, with a golden true jade-light sash. Her mouth ever emits red *qi*, its light pouring into the Profound Darkness Star.

She wears a purple dawn flying splendor crown and a nine-hued robe, with a divine tiger jade-patterned sash. Her mouth ever emits white *qi*, its light pouring into the Cinnabar Prime Star.

**Sixth, the Opening Yang Star:** Within the Purple Culmen Palace dwells the Peaceful Upper Dawn Splendor Prime August Lady, named *Jade Prime*, with the style *Splendor Root*, whose true name is [omitted]. She wears a jade dawn advancing-worthy crown and a flying azure robe, with a flowing-gold fire bell sash. Her mouth ever emits green *qi*, its light pouring into the Northern Culmen Star.

**Seventh, the Jade Light Star:** Within the Heaven-Moving Palace dwells the Jade Splendor Numinous August Lady, named *Celebrating Prime*, with the style *Final Convergence*, whose true name is [omitted]. She wears a flying splendor cloud topknot, a seven-hued night-luminous cloud brocade skirt, and a nine-hued brocade cloak, with a heavenly might numinous jade baton sash. Her mouth ever emits red *qi*, its light pouring into the Celestial Pass Star.

**Eighth, the Cavern Brightness Star:** Within the True Emptiness Palace dwells the Supreme Brightness August Lady, named *Dark Ascent*, with the style *Prime Tone*, whose true name is [omitted]. She wears a cloud topknot and a flying net-cloud robe, with a nine-light sash. Her mouth ever emits azure *qi*, its light pouring into the Auxiliary Stars.

**Ninth, the Hidden Prime Star:** Within the Constant Treasure Palace dwells the Empty Mystery Transforming Numinous Supreme August Lady, named *Dark Permeation*, with the style *Myriad Radiance*, whose true name is [omitted]. She wears a seven-tiered jade crown and an azure-patterned brocade skirt, with a nine-light night-candle sash. Her mouth ever emits black *qi*, its light pouring into the Adjuvant Stars.

To accuse another’s wrongs and clarify one’s own rightness, to suppress another’s evil and extend one’s own goodness, to reproach oneself rather than resent others, to comprehend principle and each seek blessing—thus eliminating transgressions and prolonging fortune—one petitions the Heavenly Grand Commandant, the First Jade Thearch.

For those studying the offices of yin and yang to seek rank and emolument, one petitions the Heavenly Grand Steward, the Second Jade Thearch.

For those studying the Dao in hopes of becoming immortals, to communicate with spirits and attain sagehood, one petitions the Heavenly Minister of Works, the Third Jade Thearch.

To subdue the malevolence of humans and ghosts, to punish and execute the wicked and perverse in the hidden and manifest realms, one petitions the Heavenly Mobile Strike General, the Fourth Jade Thearch.

To establish merit and build virtue, to increase one’s lifespan and prolong one’s years, one petitions the Dipper Lord, the Fifth Jade Thearch.

To alleviate distress, illness, and hardship, to beseech relief and exemption, one petitions the Heavenly Grand Constancy, the Sixth Jade Thearch.

When heaven and earth are obstructed and *qi* conditions are unbalanced, one petitions the Heavenly Supreme Thearch, the Seventh Jade Thearch.

To dispel and avert manifold disasters, to ascend above and tread below, one petitions the Heavenly Jade Thearch, the Eighth Jade Thearch.

For boundless transformations to respond and save all, one petitions the Supreme Thearch, the Ninth Jade Thearch.

The inner names and hidden styles of the Nine Thearchs and Nine August Ladies—those who know them shall extend their lifespan by seven thousand years.

Each evening at dusk, one observes and visualizes the august forms and majestic radiance of the Jade Thearchs and August Ladies, recalling their inner names and hidden styles. With focused contemplation, if one succeeds in beholding the eighth and ninth stars, one’s lifespan shall become boundless.

The Nine Thearchs and Nine August Ladies are the refined essences of the nine *qi*, the numinous spirits of the Nine Heavens, the wondrous manifestations of the Nine Stars, and the awe-inspiring deities of the Nine Transformations. Men and women who study the Dao, wear and offer them in ritual, and in all activities—whether coming or going, sitting or reclining—meditate upon the true, shall find that in times of sorrow or joy, illness or hardship, they bring healing and support, cultivate the self and aid others. By constantly bearing them in mind, disasters dissolve, misfortunes scatter, and profound blessings commune with the divine.

In times of urgent need, inscribe the talisman in cinnabar on bamboo or silk according to the method, face north, bow twice, and ingest it with well-flower water. After completing one cycle of nine watches, a dose of one or two measures, taken thrice, will cure illness—then one may cease. There is no other incantation; one need only hold the nine hidden names in mind. Diligently performing good deeds without slackening for nine years will assuredly grant divine transcendence.

The essentials of the Jade Thearch must not be recklessly disclosed; cultivate them in secrecy, and one shall attain the rank of Perfected Person and Primordial Lord, associating with the supreme sages—the Three Pure Ones and the Primordial Perfected of Yuanshi. Upon receiving this, inscribe it on silk and illustrate it, presenting it with reverent petition. By secretly preserving the hidden names in one’s heart, one shall achieve immortality.

When receiving the *Hetu*, one must first petition the inner names of the Nine Thearchs. After observing a nine-day, seven-day, three-day, or one-day retreat as circumstances permit, submit a petition to announce the transmission. Within three days, in a mountain retreat, altar hall, or secluded chamber—wherever it is pure and tranquil—present the memorial as follows:

The Most High Master of the Cavernous Law of [Your] Peak, the Perfected of the Nine Palaces, your humble servant [Your Name], bows twice and respectfully addresses:

The Most High Boundless Dao, the Supreme Non-Being and Perfectly True Heavenly Worthy; the Lofty Myriad Perfected, the Jade Dawn Dao Lord; the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley; the Thearchs and Emperors of all heavens; the Nine August Lords of the Posterior Saints and Nine Mysteries before the Golden Portal of the Jade Palace; the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad and Supreme Perfected; the Great Master of the Mysterious Center; and all luminous spirits within and beyond the Three Realms:

Since the beginningless kalpas, your servant has revolved through cycles of good affinity, attaining this humble and ordinary form. By grace, I have heard the wondrous Dharma, received its secret essentials, and bear its profound indebtedness. Through fortunate karmic convergence, I have traversed many lands. On the [day] of [month] in the year [year], in the [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village], I received from the male/female master [Name] the precious scripture of the *Hetu*, the hidden names of the Supreme Clarity, and the practice of wearing and cultivating them.

Today, I have witnessed the strictness of the Dharma’s prohibitions against reckless transmission and the requirement to seek worthy recipients, yet I cannot withhold it. Now, in the [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village]—or presently residing in [location]—the male/female Daoist [Name], in the mountain retreat or hall of [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village], has submitted a petition seeking to receive it. Their sincerity and earnestness are fully sufficient, and their worthiness is evident.

Yet your servant, being dull and obscured, has not yet attained spiritual penetration. Discerning others is ever difficult, and I dare not presume to guarantee secrecy. Thus, in strict adherence to the precepts and methods, I solemnly transmit the true teaching, announcing this sacred transmission to the mysterious overseers.

I humbly pray that the Most High Boundless Dao and Heavenly Worthy, pervading all within the Three Realms, may command all divine beings to descend with responsive numinosity, rewarding the resolve to perform good deeds. After this transmission, may the recipient reform past transgressions and cultivate future conduct, with divine Perfected protecting them and evil demons daring not intrude. May they encounter virtuous companions, subdue malevolent forces, open their hearts to enlightenment, and align their actions with the true.

Your disciple [Name], vowing to focus the mind and return to the source, shall not dare to drift with the currents. Through ascetic practice and reverent adherence, I shall first relinquish all faults, rescue my kin, and establish new merits. I swear never to scheme for glory or desire, nor indulge in treachery or licentiousness. I shall sever ties with thieves and robbers, block the paths of recklessness, refrain from killing or lewdness, falsehood or theft, arrogance or violence. I shall guard the One and preserve the Three, practice the Five and embody the Seven, and perfect the Nine Treasures and Ten Virtues. I shall purify the filth of jealousy and envy, wash away the dust of yin oppression, not suppress the worthy or betray the Way of the master, not revile or insult anyone, nor reveal essential teachings. I shall not mourn excessively in grief, nor collude with women to usurp the true, nor indulge in drunken singing to disrupt propriety, nor deceive others with harsh words, nor act cunningly toward spirits or belittle beings. I shall not rely on high status to bully the lowly, steal or alter scriptures, tamper with diagrams or decrees, slander sacred texts, create my own methods, lead others astray, or misguide the masses. For all such past transgressions, I beseech forgiveness; henceforth, I shall not dare to repeat them.

I implore the lofty sages and great deities—the Jade Dawn Great Emperor and the Great Master of the Mysterious Center—to deign to witness this. May they command the benevolent spirits of the ten directions and the officials of the Three Realms to follow the karmic sequence, protect and bestow compassion. In great mercy and magnanimity, may they perfect goodness and bestow blessings, purify the turbid, enlighten the ignorant, secure the imperiled, and reconnect the severed.

May your servant’s talents and wisdom be outstanding, spared from all disasters, with lifespan prolonged and virtue harmonized with the Perfected. May my ancestors of a hundred million generations ascend to the Hall of Blessings, and may all kin—inner and outer—attain peace. May my transformative deeds and merits be unimpeded wherever I tread, my wisdom illuminate all, and my constant preservation be boundless. May my descendants flourish, their wisdom exceptional, their heavenly and earthly ranks enduring and secure. May the Dao’s influence spread widely, and may all—seen and unseen—receive its grace.

Should my prayers be granted, I shall inscribe this profound mercy in my heart. Though my presumption knows no bounds and may offend your majesty, I prostrate myself in shame and trepidation. Relying on the grace of your benevolence, I nourish this withered form, diligently purifying myself in reverence, awaiting the response of the wondrous gate. I exhaust my sincere devotion, awaiting the verification of divine efficacy.

Your servant and [Name], together, pledge our bodies and minds, aspiring to the ultimate. We shall not betray what has been declared.

We beseech the Most High and Perfectly True Heavenly Worthy, the Lofty Myriad Perfected and Jade Dawn Dao Lord, to bestow your compassionate discernment.

Yet human life is ever in motion, truly beset by many [lacuna]. Through ignorance and darkness, one strays from the true path, leading to delusion and loss of the correct Way.

Upon reflection, principle resides in the realm of existence, and one cannot be without mind. What the mind pursues must be to dispel darkness and seek illumination. When the rites are perfected, divine protection will surely arrive; when transgressions are absolved, virtuous wishes will surely harmonize.

In accordance with this principle, this servant dares to lay bare this sincere heart.

The ancient sages offered sacrifices to Heaven in the wilds and to Earth in the open, gazing in reverence toward mountains and rivers. The former sages bequeathed these rites in their external counsels, and later sages upheld them to perfect virtue. As for invoking the Five Elders to pray to the Great One, summoning the Eight Numinous Ones to attract the Six Spirits—these mysteries were already expounded in the inner teachings, and the luminous decrees followed to propagate the Dao. Ranks and positions are ordered, their wonder lying in the absence of deviation.

Azure silk adorned with *lin* and *feng* birds, jade-like wine and nectar of jasper—these are the provisions of those who ascend to the heights, not the means of the lowly and impoverished.

I humbly beseech the luminous spirits, the great sages, the perfected and august deities to bestow their compassionate protection and fulfill my earnest supplications. Now, relying on the Mysterious Perfection to bring good to completion without abandonment, I have meticulously cleansed myself, washing body and heart, offering myself first to atone for all transgressions.

From the beginningless world through countless kalpas, I have transmigrated without cease—now as man, now as woman—until this present life. At times, my nature has been base and obscured, my resolve reckless and wild. I have failed to believe in the Great Dao, failed to revere the divine. As a child, I was unfilial; as a father, unkind. As a ruler, I lacked the Way; as a minister, loyalty. As an elder brother, I was unfraternal; as a younger, discordant. As an elder, I was careless; as a youth, irreverent. As a teacher, I was disrespected; as a disciple, negligent. As a friend, I was unrighteous; as a companion, insincere. As an aunt, I was unkind; as a wife, irreverent. As a mother, unloving; as a sister-in-law, undutiful. To my maternal uncles, I was disrespectful; to my paternal uncles, unbenevolent. To my sisters-in-law, I was unyielding; to my concubines, arrogant. With my spouse, I was disharmonious; among my children, unjust. Within, I was restless; without, unclear. To my superiors, I was unruly; to my subordinates, impure. To the lowly, I was insolent; to the noble, corrupt. As a man, I was unclean; as a woman, unchaste. I failed to grasp the principles of righteousness, failed to comprehend the subtle wonders. I was ignorant of the Mysterious Origin, entangled in worldly affairs, my thoughts mired in the dusty paths, forgetting to transcend the sea of俗. The five passions and six desires disturbed my spirit; the three poisons and seven accumulations confounded my heart. My deeds lacked focus, my choices were inconsistent, my conduct wavering. Heretical thoughts filled my mind, the Dao’s influence waned, and the world’s standards crumbled. My body and years declined, my transgressions accumulated daily. In action, I disregarded benefit; in stillness, I neglected precepts. Profound blessings and great goodness I never considered; vast calamities and grievous evils I committed day and night.

At times, in urgency, I briefly upheld the Dao, only to forget the True when circumstances eased. I acted perversely, indulging my will without restraint. Sometimes, I relied on power and influence, wielding authority with arrogance. At others, I undermined the Dao and corrupted virtue, harming rulers and kin, destroying scriptures and diagrams, assaulting my teachers, injuring my peers, slaughtering friends, oppressing all beings, and scorning the spirits. I desecrated tombs, opened coffins, mutilated corpses, punished ghosts, disturbed bones, and startled the dead, causing pain to my companions and distress to heaven and humanity. I hacked at spirit tablets, burned shrines, secretly plotted rebellion while outwardly feigning obedience. I envied those superior to me, slandered the loyal and steadfast, unleashed cruelty, suppressed the worthy, abandoned friends, tormented my homeland, slandered the good, mocked the talented, hoarded for myself, and refused to give to others. I seized from all quarters to enrich myself alone, devoured the people’s livelihood, and extorted in myriad ways, never satisfied, encroaching upon gods and men.

At times, I exploited my status or wealth to bully the lowly and orphaned, or seized what others loved, severing the six relations, cutting off kin, and isolating neighbors. I violated the nine degrees of kinship, indulged in myriad perversions, lost all restraint, schemed without scruple, cursed others, and falsely accused the virtuous. I railed and reviled, invoking ghosts and spirits, pointing at the sun and moon, and lodging complaints with the stars. I encouraged others to do evil, failed to teach the young, acted recklessly in darkness, and watched others succeed or fail. I indulged in lust and wine, adorned myself for vanity, my heart and mind inverted, my nature coarse, cruel, and violent. My laughter and tears were erratic, my conduct unchecked. I struck out in all directions, overturning all before me. At times, my hands committed violence; at others, I abetted others’ cruelty. I recklessly offended gods and men, disturbed the pure and tranquil, and arrogantly defied the luminous spirits. I criticized the scriptures and teachings, slandered the true Dharma, betrayed promises, deceived with cunning, flattered with seductive words, and fawned with insincerity. I was wrathful and resentful, cruel and domineering, arrogant and overbearing, my greed growing daily. I gambled for victory, mocked the weak, deceived the court and the countryside, and ridiculed the inner chambers. Outwardly, I feigned integrity while inwardly harboring treachery, manipulating right and wrong to advance my ends. I forcibly claimed the stars, boasted of my divination, falsely predicted fortune and misfortune, and acted duplicitously, praising to the face and slandering behind the back. With honeyed words and false smiles, I misled my homeland and disrupted my ancestral state. I disrespected the virtuous, rejected loyal advice, secretly envied the excellent, and covertly harmed the capable. I impersonated gods and spirits, falsely invoked the celestial, spoke deceitfully, and bewitched the people, stirring heaven and earth, startling the divine. I blocked roads, separated mother and child, obstructed the good, and suppressed the virtuous. I stockpiled medicines to wish illness upon others, hoarded coffins to await their deaths, disparaged others’ learning while praising my own, fabricated empty doctrines, and misapplied a single method, failing to grasp the subtleties of transformation and harboring doubts. I used public office for private gain, misled later generations, delighted in foulness, and shunned purity. I galloped in the hunt, cursed the wind and rain, committed robbery and theft, and shot arrows at heaven and earth.

My transgressions—whether hidden or manifest, mortal or spiritual—are known throughout the unseen and visible realms. I have defied reason, violated the scriptures, broken the laws and precepts. Above, I have betrayed the Three Luminaries, the Four Seasons, and the Five Phases; below, I have offended the myriad phenomena, the Nine Palaces, and the Six Jia. In between, I have disturbed the local deities, the spirits of tombs and dwellings, the souls of my ancestors, the hearth and gate gods, the spirits of roads and thresholds, and all the deities of the paths I have trodden. Wherever I have gone, I have neglected sacrifices, violated harmony, and broken prohibitions, accumulating transgressions in every place.

Should some transgressions be committed knowingly, others by unwitting error; some under coercion by others, others self-wrought in body and mind; some endured without remorse, others repented yet unatoned; some atoned yet repeated, never fully reformed; some long exiled by fate’s probing, never truly reformed; some accrued day by day, month by month, boundless and immeasurable, beyond full recounting—

Or entangled by kinship, tainted by inner and outer influences, where men and women, young and old, all kinfolk, in past lives and this, share in guilt, each leading the other astray. Some conspire together, some act at the behest of superiors, some bound by mutual pledges, sowing the roots of sin in others, their karmic ties unseen.

Or wavering in resolve, failing trials, incurring the wrath of gods and ghosts, entangling masters and disciples in misfortune; old grudges unresolved, new faults compounding, growing ever more intricate.

Or once enslaved, made to serve Hu, Yi, Man, Mo, Rong, Di, Qiang, fish and birds, insects and beasts, demons and malevolent spirits—creatures coarse and vile—devouring one another in endless cycles of vengeance unfulfilled.

The offenses listed here are but a fraction, unending through kalpas, beyond memory or reckoning. Whether committed or not, one cannot discern, for all are recorded in the Two Palaces and the Seventy-Four Bureaus, their cases reviewed by the Three Primes and the One Hundred Twenty Offices. With guilt so deep, judgment lies beyond measure—fearing that in a single day, one may return to dust, and even minor matters may fall short of worldly expectations.

May malevolent omens dissipate, all good wishes be granted, dreams be true, tombs and dwellings peaceful, calamities cease, and inner and outer realms harmonize—revealing the efficacy of the mysterious and divine, repaying my deepest hopes.

**Essential Methods for Observing the Stars**

After receiving the taboo names of the Nine August Ones, on a clear night, invoke the heavens and diligently observe the Northern Dipper. Visualize and memorize the order of the stars, their inner and outer names, and imagine the descent of the deities, speaking with them in your mind. Next, seek the *Fubi* stars, striving to perceive their forms. With focused concentration and reverent gaze, you will eventually behold them.

The observation of stars must be kept secret; do not let others know. If questioned, respond vaguely. Do not reveal anything, whether you see them or not—utter no word of it. Only the heart and eyes may share this knowledge.

When observing the stars, purify your body and *qi*. If defiled, bathe; if impure, change your garments. Clothing should be fragrant, and both inner and outer aspects immaculate. Where incense burns, invoke the mysterious spirits. Study the scriptures and charts carefully, memorizing them clearly before gazing outward. Do not speak carelessly or boastfully, and do not gather many people—only two or three like-minded companions. If a companion lacks the proper resolve, do not observe with them; each should practice separately, without visiting or inquiring of one another.

If fatigued, intoxicated, sated, or after conjugal union, or if one’s *qi* is unsettled, do not look upon the stars. Furthermore, if offerings, repentance rites, prostrations, or prayers for grace yield no signs over time, it is due to a lack of observation. Though one may not yet see the stars, sincerity and devotion will gradually bring results. Persist without slackening, and you will surely attain clarity. Once seen, the deities will descend, the offerings will prove efficacious, and boundless aid will follow. If one does not diligently study and observe the stars with a focused mind, demonic forces may assail them, inauspicious omens arise, and offerings will be wasted, laboring in vain while incurring transgressions. Those of resolute intent should take heed and be warned.

The nine stars govern distinct regions, and their configurations foretell fortune or misfortune in travel, residence, and all undertakings. Both Daoists and laypeople must examine them carefully to determine what is fitting, whether to proceed or withdraw, to transform failure into success, to seek the worthy and find them, to consult the sagely and encounter them. All actions will be upright and enduringly auspicious.

In serving the Nine August Sovereign Lords, whether by day or night, in movement or stillness, eating, drinking, or conjugal union, constantly visualize their presence. In every posture and gesture, never forget them. After nine years, the deities will descend, and you will receive the secret of eternal life.

The center of the heavens is called the Northern Asterism, comprising five stars. The first, the great star, is named *Tianshu* (Celestial Pivot), the Mother. The second is the Son, the third the Crown Prince, the fourth the Second Son, and the fifth is called *Beiji* (Northern Pole), born of *Tianyi* (Heavenly One). *Taiyi* (Great One) resides in the Purple Palace. To the east of the Purple Palace are eight stars, to the west seven, arrayed as vassal ministers. At its center lies the Purple Tenuity Palace, where *Taiyi* dwells, governing the five officials and the twenty-eight constellations. The five planets—Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth—correspond to the five stars, and the five stars correspond to the five phases. The Northern Dipper belongs to *Taiyi*, and *Taiyi* is the Pole, occupying the most exalted position.

The nine stars of the Northern Dipper guard *Taiyi*, and their auspices—whether fortunate or ill—are determined as follows:

The Northern Pole is the hollow center of the heavens. The Northern Pole lies south of this hollow, and the hollow lies north of the Northern Pole, hence it is called the Northern Asterism, around which all stars revolve.

1. The first star is the head of the Dipper, named *Tianshu* (Celestial Pivot), also called the *Zhengxing* (Principal Star) or *Tanlang* (Greedy Wolf). It holds the position of Imperial Censor and represents the heavens and the sun, governing yang virtue and symbolizing the Son of Heaven. Its domain is *Xuzhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Bishu*, *Kui*, and *Lou*, and it governs the fifth earthly branch (*chen*), associated with Jupiter.

2. The second star is *Dixuan* (Celestial Rotator), also called the *Faxing* (Law Star) or *Jumen* (Great Gate). It holds the position of Grand Marshal and represents the earth and the moon, governing yin punishment and symbolizing the Queen. Its domain is *Liangzhou* (later divided into *Yizhou*), corresponding to the constellations *Wei*, *Mao*, and *Bi*, and it governs the fifth branch (*hai*), associated with the Grand White Star.

3. The third star is *Renji* (Human Axis), also called the *Mingxing* (Life Star) or *Lucun* (Salary Storage). It holds the position of Chamberlain for the Palace Revenues and represents humanity, governing calamities. Its domain is *Jizhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Shen*, *Jing*, *Gui*, and *Liu*, and it governs the fifth branch (*xu*), associated with Mars.

4. The fourth star is *Wuquan* (Material Balance), also called the *Faxing* (Punishment Star) or *Wenqu* (Literary Curvature). It holds the position of Minister of Education and Grand Master of Ceremonies and represents the four seasons, governing the punishment of the unrighteous. Its domain is *Jingzhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Qixing*, *Zhang*, *Yi*, and *Zhen*, and it governs the fifth branch (*mao*), associated with Mercury.

5. The fifth star is *Yuheng* (Jade Balance), also called the *Shaxing* (Execution Star) or *Lianzhen* (Upright Integrity). It holds the position of Grand Herald and governs the execution of the guilty. Its domain is *Yanzhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Jiao*, *Kang*, *Di*, and *Fang*, and it governs the fifth branch (*chen*), associated with Saturn.

6. The sixth star is *Kaiyang* (Opening Yang), also called the *Weixing* (Danger Star) or *Wuqu* (Martial Curvature). It holds the position of Commandant of Justice and governs the sustenance of grain. Its domain is *Yangzhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Xin*, *Wei*, and *Ji*, and it governs the five colors, associated with Jupiter.

7. The seventh star is *Yaoguang* (Luminous Jade), also called the *Buxing* (Department Star) or *Pojun* (Breaking Army). It holds the position of Commandant of the Capital and governs warfare. Its domain is *Yuzhou*, corresponding to the constellations *Dou*, *Niu*, *Nü*, *Xu*, and *Wei*, and it governs the fifth branch (*wu*), associated with Venus.

8. The eighth star is the *Waifu* (Outer Assistant), located below the sixth star of the Northern Dipper, approximately one *cun* away.

9. The ninth star is the *Neifu* (Inner Assistant), a single star above the third star of the Northern Dipper, which is not ordinarily visible. If seen, it portends the attainment of divine sagehood.

When divining the eight stars, examine their positions within their domains. If a star’s position portends disaster or its domain suffers harm, one should avoid it. For minor afflictions, perform exorcisms, cultivate merit, establish rites, and offer repentance to invoke grace—all in secret, without speaking of it. Thus, misfortune will dissipate, and blessings will gather.

Virtue is the myriad of good deeds. Though the myriad practices bear myriad names, their essentials number nine: first, refraining from killing; second, refraining from licentiousness; third, refraining from falsehood; fourth, refraining from theft; fifth, refraining from perversity; sixth, refraining from wrath; seventh, refraining from envy; eighth, refraining from arrogance; ninth, refraining from stagnation. These are the Nine Virtues, possessed by those who attain the Dao.

The Nine Meritorious Deeds are these: first, releasing life and rescuing the dying; second, rewarding chastity and encouraging purity; third, offering loyalty and demonstrating trustworthiness; fourth, bestowing alms and eliminating greed; fifth, moderating wine and upholding integrity; sixth, reconciling disputes and admonishing strife; seventh, prohibiting villainy and halting jealousy; eighth, respecting and loving both high and low; ninth, alleviating sorrow and resolving distress. These are the Nine Meritorious Deeds, impartial and selfless.

Merit is cultivated outwardly, while virtue is established inwardly. With inner foundation and outer practice, the divine will surely descend upon you in secret. Those of exceptional talent and diligent practice may verify this in silence; transmit it only to those of like mind, and reveal it to no others. Observe the differences, and let your heart discern their significance. By this method, the efficacy of past and present may be known. Those lacking merit and practice will perceive it dimly, or their eyes may be deceived by malevolent spirits, seeing what seems but is not—proclaiming misfortune as fortune, or fortune as misfortune—contradicting the scriptures. In such cases, one should reflect on one’s transgressions and repent inwardly before observing again.

1. The first is the Lady of the Supreme Palace, the Hidden and Concealed Consort of the Primordial, surnamed Yanming, with the taboo name Taiyi Fatǎn, styled Xing Zhengfu. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a yellow brocade mantle and a vermilion-and-indigo flying skirt, her hair bound in a cloud-like topknot—later eight topknots are the same.

2. The second is the Lady of the Middle Prime Palace, the Womb-Protecting and Form-Transforming Consort, surnamed Kaiguan, with the taboo name Taiyi Sanlai Píng, styled Luozhu Ying. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a blue-green brocade mantle and a green-feathered flying skirt.

3. The third is the Holy Mother of the True Prime Palace, Mistress of the Six Concealments and Seven Hiding-Places, surnamed Mingmeng, with the taboo name Taiyi Lingyi, styled Chong Shuangzhao. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a blue-green brocade mantle and an embroidered-feather patterned skirt.

4. The fourth is the Lady of the Hidden Light Palace, the Concealing Radiance and Veiling Brilliance Consort of the Middle Prime, surnamed Kaoyao, with the taboo name Taiyi Qilie, styled Heng Danpan. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a purple brocade mantle and a yellow-flowered feathered skirt.

5. The fifth is the Great Maiden of the Net-Spirit Palace, the Body-Transforming and Brilliance-Altering Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, surnamed Xuanlu, with the taboo name Taiyi Yushu, styled Chou Qiulan. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a vermilion brocade mantle and a purple-and-indigo flying skirt.

6. The sixth is the Middle Maiden of the Bright Record Palace, the Concealing Traces and Dispersing Brilliance Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, surnamed Feilian, with the taboo name Taiyi Qijing, styled Baoding Ling. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a vermilion brocade mantle and a blue-green embroidered flying skirt.

7. The seventh is the Youngest Maiden of the Barrier Assembly Palace, the Multiform and Brilliance-Dividing Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, surnamed Wengchong, with the taboo name Taiyi Yumo, styled Tian Fan Shu. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a cinnabar brocade mantle and a blue-green-flowered feathered skirt.

8. The eighth is the Left Lady of the High Emperor’s Seat Palace, the Sun-and-Moon-Transforming and Water-and-Fire-Transforming Consort of the Dipper’s Center, surnamed Changming, with the taboo name Taiyi Shiqizhu, styled Luomaohua. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a purple brocade mantle and an embroidered-feather flying cinnabar skirt.

9. The ninth is the Right Lady of the Supreme Venerable Palace, the Metal-and-Stone and Mountains-and-Rivers-Transforming Consort of the Dipper’s Center, surnamed Konghuang, with the taboo name Taiyi Aixiu, styled Yun Yuxuan. Her true name is [omitted]. She wears a green brocade mantle and a kingfisher-feather patterned skirt.

The above are the Nine Imperial Lords and the Nine Hidden Consorts of the Dipper’s Central Palace, along with their Yin names. When invoking or reciting them, mention only their titles and names, without describing their attire, mantles, or hairstyles.

If you can master the Nine Yin [names] of the Imperial Lords, you will ascend at dawn to the heavens and be enfeoffed as a Perfected One of the Highest Clarity. Throughout your life, you will be spared the disasters of mourning and calamity. The spirits of the Great Yin will guard and attend you, and the myriad numinous beings will bow in reverence. You will divide your form and disperse your transformations, merging with Heaven and Earth.

These Nine Ladies of the Great Yin are the Yin officials and spirits of the Imperial Lords. If you practice the Dao, untie karmic knots, present talismans to the celestial registers, pacify the hun-soul, control the po-soul, transform and generate the body’s spirit and qi, and refine essence to seek longevity—yet remain ignorant of the names of the Imperial Consorts and fail to practice the Nine Yin to achieve union—you will never attain immortality.

One *cun* inward from the space between the eyebrows lies the Hall of Light, a perfect square of one *cun*, where the Nine Yin Consorts of the Imperial Lord constantly reside. Always on the even days of the month, during the hours of living qi, burn incense and enter a separate chamber. Sit or recline as you wish, close your eyes for a long while, and visualize the Imperial Lord seated in the Purple Chamber of the Supreme Ultimate. Then visualize the Five Spirits of Taiyi within the Six Harmonies, the Nine Stars of the Northern Dipper within your heart, and the Nine Yin Consorts within the Hall of Light. Next, visualize the Luminous Essence Lad of the Grand Tenuity standing before the Imperial Lord, the lad holding the Five Talismans in his left hand and the Five Registers in his right. Then visualize your own form standing behind the lad. Afterward, visualize the Nine Yin Consorts ascending from the Hall of Light into the Purple Chamber of the Supreme Ultimate, standing in a horizontal line behind you in order. Then visualize the Five Spirits of Taiyi ascending from the Six Harmonies into the Purple Chamber of the Supreme Ultimate, standing in a horizontal line behind the Nine Yin Consorts.

Once all is complete, the Imperial Lord and the host of spirits suddenly merge into one, transforming into a single being resembling a newborn infant, named the Eternal Lad, styled Transformation. In his left hand he holds the Nine Stars, on his head he wears the sun, and in his mouth he holds the moon. The lad illuminates your entire body with the light of the sun, moon, and Nine Stars, penetrating you inside and out. You will feel your body suffused with red, ablaze like fire, with no distinction between inner and outer—all radiant and luminous.

This is the myriad transformations of the Imperial Lord, Taiyi, and the Nine Yin in union. After a long while, conclude by knocking the teeth twenty-four times and swallowing saliva nine times. Then softly intone the incantation:

"Radiant spirit of the Grotto-Heaven,
revolving and illuminating the Purple Clarity,
Nine Mornings of the Dark Yin,
concealed and submerged in the unfathomable.
Ladies of the Dipper’s midst,
Three Maidens dispersing their forms..."

The divine consorts transform within, and the myriad things instantly take form. Lightning flashes and thunder crashes, clouds and mists flow like ringing bells. Nine transformations and ten evolutions give rise to cinnabar and bring forth verdant hues. The Nine Maidens of Taiyi unite in harmonious fusion, while the Lad of Impermanence roams freely, vanishing into the void and weaving through the obscure.

Adorned in brocade capes and resplendent sleeves, their skirts of purple feathers take flight. To their left, they bear concealed talismans; to their right, tiger-patterned sashes. They hold the Dipper in their mouths and wear fire upon their heads, grasping the banner of absolutes. Beside them, they command the Eight Winds, and from all four directions, they draw forth radiant clouds. Roaming the celestial net, they dissolve the Seven Origins, concealing mountains and rivers. They turn the Five Celestial Bodies, eclipsing the sun’s brilliance, and the constellations lose their true forms.

Dividing into a hundred shapes, their transformed bodies enter a thousand. In fire, they become fire; in forests, they become forests. In water, they become water; in mountains, they become mountains. What is sought arrives in an instant; what is summoned appears before one. In the blink of an eye, desires are fulfilled, and with a glance, all is attained. A thousand kinds and ten thousand things follow the heart’s command.

The Imperial Lord takes form, and the Supreme Jade Clarity of Tai Shang shares the same radiance. The Primordial Hero and the Four Scripts of White Origin endure with heaven and earth, preserving and nurturing my body. Whatever the mouth utters, transformations follow intent. Jade lads attend in service, jade maidens hold towels, divine consorts offer incense, and the Four Perfected share the same carriage. Every matter and thing conforms to my words.

*The Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart of Supreme Clarity* concludes.

chunks.original_text: 上清河图内玄经 经名：上清河图内玄经。 撰人不详，约出於东晋南期。 系早期上清派经典。 有太一密讳、河图九皇宝箓、观星要法等篇。 二卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 上清河图内玄经卷上 玄师圣匠#1，代代相传，感至斯盛，光歇兹泯，往返善恶，一废一兴，沈而更举，绝而重联，悠悠骄慢，永隔良因，专专谨密，增长善绿，缘善能感，玄应重臻，臻则有异，异则通神，神师灵典，秘字要文，自然降见，荡垢消尘，嘿识遵奉，长生神仙，济身救物，三乘互陈，幽显无弃，不顺自沦，沦苦可痛，各宜畏旃，慎终如始，乃合道焉。 凡自然真文，皆空中本有，是以或飞或沈，或隐或显，龙马龟鱼，所负图象，皆生无始，随感现出，出现参差，唯善是与。 得之者在后，其文久在前，今之所得，得与者同，悉金玉简札，镂写秘藏，谙忆究解。 存诵修行，亦以缣素，朱书佩身，备有遗忘。 急则寻详，行之消灾，却祸延福，久习不怠，登圣真仙。 师资斋洁，启玄告灵，非人忽传，妄泄殃深，明各加慎，密而遵承也。 太一秘讳二 太一者，道之子也。 道应物之感，现神生一，一神接导，生成一切，无穷无极。 为学之先，先觉习此，以成至真，真圣相传，以引后学。 后学后觉顺从，与先为一，与先为一，乃与道同。 三才五德，九皇尊灵，变化之所起，救群品所资，此太一、三五及九神，道之源极也。 一则总统幽显，为无象之宗，二则玄元始交气，为天地人，人有利钝平，天地应之为三品，离合为五，三三合九，变化备具，炼无炼有，有无洞达，由乎至人。 人法地，地法天，天法道，道法自然。 三才有形，堪能行道，行道究竟，阶同自然，差次虽五，共归一源。 故太一之神，最尊最贵，生天立地，成人物也。 凡不受河图本源，不佩真字，不识本源太一，不存五神，不守三一，不事九皇，皆不得行大谢。 大谢请召，启告周徧，尊极灵讳，内神隐名，不经师受，慎勿妄修。 修用宜受，受之诣师，而因缘得文，当依玄盟之仪。 依玄盟之仪，人不可妄作一法，强冒行之。 行之得罪，陷己误人。 必愿奉行，当密寻明师，及觅玄盟之仪，精心洁己，自然相遇。 依科先具启告，表奏既竟，设醮献诚，唯谨唯密，有违则考臻，能勤能笃，久顺则福至，福至积德，与道俱存。 太一尊神，讳务犹收，字归会昌，一名解明，一名寄频。 因缘积善，遇此真讳，密识心存，动静潜咒，乞愿所求，随心愿念，不得告人。 若非其人，彼此得罪。 欲免罪期福，嘿识存之，恒见太一尊神光象，炜烨异常，在己左右，或坐或行，缓急日夜，谛存不忘，则凶消吉至，久必对言，言合形同，共为一也。 不能昼夜恒存者，可夕存之，在己身六合宫中。 入两眉间却入一寸为明堂，二寸为洞房，洞房南，明堂北，是六合宫，上有太极宫。 太一昼居太极，夜居六合也。 常能存此，功行日新，魔不敢犯。 若不知太一，空行功德，为邪所破，德业无成矣。 学者求成，存一为急也。 九皇宝箓三 第一阳明星，玉皇九晨君。 天枢星，此阳明之魂神也，对阳明西北门，上真皇夫人。 第二阴精星，玉皇北上晨君。 天旋星，此阴精之魂神也，对阴精西门，上玄皇夫人。

**The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the mid-to-late Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Supreme Clarity tradition. Contains sections such as *The Secret Taboo Names of the Great One*, *The Nine August Treasure Registers of the River Chart*, and *Essential Methods for Observing the Stars*. Two scrolls in total. Source of base text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *The Supreme Clarity Inner Mystery Scripture of the River Chart, Scroll One*

The mysterious masters and sagely artisans, transmitting from generation to generation, have sensed this flourishing age. When its radiance wanes and fades, the cycles of good and evil alternate—now declining, now rising; sinking, then reviving; severed, yet reconnecting. Arrogance and negligence forever sever good causes, while single-minded reverence and secrecy nurture the growth of virtue. Through virtue, one may perceive the Dao’s response, and where the response gathers, anomalies arise. Anomalies lead to communion with the divine, and divine masters bequeath sacred texts—secret graphs and essential writings—naturally manifesting to cleanse filth and dispel dust. Silent recognition and adherence bring longevity and transcendence, delivering the self and saving all beings. The Three Vehicles unfold in mutual exposition, neither the hidden nor the manifest discarded. Those who defy the Dao sink into ruin, and the suffering of ruin is grievous. Each should heed this warning, remaining vigilant to the end as at the beginning, for only then do they align with the Dao.

All natural true writings exist inherently in the void. Thus, they may soar or sink, conceal or reveal. Dragons, horses, tortoises, and fish bear the charts and images, all born from the beginningless, emerging in response to karmic resonance. Their manifestations vary, yet only virtue is their companion. Those who attain them come later, though the writings have long preceded them. What is obtained today is shared with those who receive them—all inscribed on jade and gold tablets, meticulously carved and secretly preserved. Mastery comes through recitation, memorization, and profound understanding. Through recitation and cultivation, one may also transcribe them in cinnabar on silk, wearing them on the body to guard against forgetfulness. In urgency, one may consult them, and their practice dispels calamities, averts misfortune, and extends blessings. With unwavering diligence over time, one ascends to the ranks of sagely transcendents.

Disciples must maintain purity and reverence when invoking the mysterious and petitioning the divine. These teachings must never be rashly transmitted to the unworthy, for reckless disclosure invites profound misfortune. All should exercise caution, upholding secrecy and adherence.

---

### *The Secret Taboo Names of the Great One (II)*

The Great One is the child of the Dao. When the Dao responds to the resonance of beings, it manifests the divine and generates the One. The One, through divine guidance, gives rise to and completes all things, boundless and infinite. For learners, the first step is to awaken and cultivate this, thereby attaining utmost authenticity. Authentic sages transmit it to guide later learners. Later learners, through compliance and awakening, unite with those who came before, and in this unity, they merge with the Dao.

The Three Powers, the Five Virtues, and the nine august numinous spirits arise from transformation and serve as the foundation for saving all beings. This Great One, the Three and Five, and the Nine Spirits are the ultimate source of the Dao. The One governs both the hidden and the manifest, serving as the origin of the formless. The Two represents the primordial exchange of qi, giving rise to Heaven, Earth, and Humanity. Humanity possesses varying degrees of acuity, and Heaven and Earth respond accordingly, forming three grades. Separation and union produce the Five, and the tripling of three yields the Nine, wherein all transformations are complete. Refining the insubstantial into the substantial, and penetrating the interrelation of being and non-being, all depends on the perfected person.

Humanity follows Earth, Earth follows Heaven, Heaven follows the Dao, and the Dao follows spontaneity. The Three Powers possess form and are capable of practicing the Dao. Through practicing the Dao to its ultimate end, one ascends to the level of spontaneity. Though their ranks differ, all share a single source. Thus, the spirit of the Great One is most revered and exalted, giving birth to Heaven and establishing Earth, and bringing forth all beings.

Those who do not receive the original source of the River Chart, do not wear the true graphs, do not recognize the primordial Great One, do not preserve the Five Spirits, do not uphold the Three Ones, and do not serve the Nine August Ones shall be unable to perform the Great Petition. The Great Petition’s invocations and supplications must encompass all directions. The most exalted and sacred taboo names, the hidden names of the inner spirits—without receiving them from a master, one must not rashly practice them. Practice should follow proper transmission, and transmission requires seeking a master. When the karmic conditions align to receive the text, one must adhere to the rites of the Mysterious Covenant.

Under the rites of the Mysterious Covenant, no one may arbitrarily perform any method or forcibly undertake its practice. Practicing it improperly incurs guilt, harming both oneself and others. Those who sincerely wish to practice must discreetly seek an enlightened master and obtain the rites of the Mysterious Covenant. Purify the heart and cleanse the self, and the encounter will occur naturally. Follow the precepts to prepare the petitions, and once the memorials are presented, perform the jiao offering with utmost sincerity. Be reverent and discreet, for violations invite investigation and punishment. Diligence and devotion over time bring blessings, and accumulated blessings cultivate virtue, which endures with the Dao.

The most revered spirit of the Great One has the taboo name *Wuyou Shou*, the style *Gui Huichang*, and alternate names *Jieming* and *Jipin*. Through the accumulation of virtuous causes, one may encounter these true taboo names. Silently recognize and inwardly preserve them, reciting them in secret during movement and stillness. Whatever one seeks or desires, focus the mind and direct the intention—yet one must not reveal them to others. If shared with the unworthy, both parties incur guilt. To avoid guilt and attain blessings, silently preserve them in the heart. Constantly visualize the radiant image of the Great One’s spirit, resplendent and extraordinary, by one’s side—whether sitting or walking, in leisure or urgency, day and night. Through unwavering contemplation, misfortune dissipates and fortune arrives. Over time, one may converse with the spirit, and speech and form will merge, becoming one.

Those unable to maintain constant visualization may focus on it at night, within the Sixfold Palace of the self. Enter between the eyebrows and retreat one inch to reach the Hall of Light; two inches to reach the Grotto Chamber. The Grotto Chamber lies to the south, the Hall of Light to the north—this is the Sixfold Palace, above which is the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. The Great One dwells in the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate by day and in the Sixfold Palace by night. Constantly preserving this practice brings daily renewal of merit and conduct, and demons dare not intrude. Without knowledge of the Great One, even virtuous deeds performed in vain will be corrupted by evil, and one’s cultivation will bear no fruit. For learners seeking accomplishment, preserving the One is of utmost urgency.

---

### *The Nine August Treasure Registers (III)*

**First:** The Yang Brightness Star, the Jade August Nine Dawn Lords. The Celestial Pivot Star—this is the spirit-soul of Yang Brightness. Opposite the northwest gate of Yang Brightness is the August Lady of the Supreme Realized Ones.

**Second:** The Yin Essence Star, the Jade August North Supreme Dawn Lord. The Celestial Rotation Star—this is the spirit-soul of Yin Essence. Opposite the west gate of Yin Essence is the August Lady of the Supreme Mystery.

Each evening at dusk, one observes and visualizes the august forms and majestic radiance of the Jade Thearchs and August Ladies, recalling their inner names and hidden styles. With focused contemplation, if one succeeds in beholding the eighth and ninth stars, one’s lifespan shall become boundless.

The Nine Thearchs and Nine August Ladies are the refined essences of the nine *qi*, the numinous spirits of the Nine Heavens, the wondrous manifestations of the Nine Stars, and the awe-inspiring deities of the Nine Transformations. Men and women who study the Dao, wear and offer them in ritual, and in all activities—whether coming or going, sitting or reclining—meditate upon the true, shall find that in times of sorrow or joy, illness or hardship, they bring healing and support, cultivate the self and aid others. By constantly bearing them in mind, disasters dissolve, misfortunes scatter, and profound blessings commune with the divine.

In times of urgent need, inscribe the talisman in cinnabar on bamboo or silk according to the method, face north, bow twice, and ingest it with well-flower water. After completing one cycle of nine watches, a dose of one or two measures, taken thrice, will cure illness—then one may cease. There is no other incantation; one need only hold the nine hidden names in mind. Diligently performing good deeds without slackening for nine years will assuredly grant divine transcendence.

The essentials of the Jade Thearch must not be recklessly disclosed; cultivate them in secrecy, and one shall attain the rank of Perfected Person and Primordial Lord, associating with the supreme sages—the Three Pure Ones and the Primordial Perfected of Yuanshi. Upon receiving this, inscribe it on silk and illustrate it, presenting it with reverent petition. By secretly preserving the hidden names in one’s heart, one shall achieve immortality.

When receiving the *Hetu*, one must first petition the inner names of the Nine Thearchs. After observing a nine-day, seven-day, three-day, or one-day retreat as circumstances permit, submit a petition to announce the transmission. Within three days, in a mountain retreat, altar hall, or secluded chamber—wherever it is pure and tranquil—present the memorial as follows:

The Most High Master of the Cavernous Law of [Your] Peak, the Perfected of the Nine Palaces, your humble servant [Your Name], bows twice and respectfully addresses:

The Most High Boundless Dao, the Supreme Non-Being and Perfectly True Heavenly Worthy; the Lofty Myriad Perfected, the Jade Dawn Dao Lord; the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley; the Thearchs and Emperors of all heavens; the Nine August Lords of the Posterior Saints and Nine Mysteries before the Golden Portal of the Jade Palace; the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad and Supreme Perfected; the Great Master of the Mysterious Center; and all luminous spirits within and beyond the Three Realms:

Since the beginningless kalpas, your servant has revolved through cycles of good affinity, attaining this humble and ordinary form. By grace, I have heard the wondrous Dharma, received its secret essentials, and bear its profound indebtedness. Through fortunate karmic convergence, I have traversed many lands. On the [day] of [month] in the year [year], in the [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village], I received from the male/female master [Name] the precious scripture of the *Hetu*, the hidden names of the Supreme Clarity, and the practice of wearing and cultivating them.

Today, I have witnessed the strictness of the Dharma’s prohibitions against reckless transmission and the requirement to seek worthy recipients, yet I cannot withhold it. Now, in the [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village]—or presently residing in [location]—the male/female Daoist [Name], in the mountain retreat or hall of [prefecture], [commandery], [county], and [village], has submitted a petition seeking to receive it. Their sincerity and earnestness are fully sufficient, and their worthiness is evident.

Yet your servant, being dull and obscured, has not yet attained spiritual penetration. Discerning others is ever difficult, and I dare not presume to guarantee secrecy. Thus, in strict adherence to the precepts and methods, I solemnly transmit the true teaching, announcing this sacred transmission to the mysterious overseers.

I humbly pray that the Most High Boundless Dao and Heavenly Worthy, pervading all within the Three Realms, may command all divine beings to descend with responsive numinosity, rewarding the resolve to perform good deeds. After this transmission, may the recipient reform past transgressions and cultivate future conduct, with divine Perfected protecting them and evil demons daring not intrude. May they encounter virtuous companions, subdue malevolent forces, open their hearts to enlightenment, and align their actions with the true.

Your disciple [Name], vowing to focus the mind and return to the source, shall not dare to drift with the currents. Through ascetic practice and reverent adherence, I shall first relinquish all faults, rescue my kin, and establish new merits. I swear never to scheme for glory or desire, nor indulge in treachery or licentiousness. I shall sever ties with thieves and robbers, block the paths of recklessness, refrain from killing or lewdness, falsehood or theft, arrogance or violence. I shall guard the One and preserve the Three, practice the Five and embody the Seven, and perfect the Nine Treasures and Ten Virtues. I shall purify the filth of jealousy and envy, wash away the dust of yin oppression, not suppress the worthy or betray the Way of the master, not revile or insult anyone, nor reveal essential teachings. I shall not mourn excessively in grief, nor collude with women to usurp the true, nor indulge in drunken singing to disrupt propriety, nor deceive others with harsh words, nor act cunningly toward spirits or belittle beings. I shall not rely on high status to bully the lowly, steal or alter scriptures, tamper with diagrams or decrees, slander sacred texts, create my own methods, lead others astray, or misguide the masses. For all such past transgressions, I beseech forgiveness; henceforth, I shall not dare to repeat them.

I implore the lofty sages and great deities—the Jade Dawn Great Emperor and the Great Master of the Mysterious Center—to deign to witness this. May they command the benevolent spirits of the ten directions and the officials of the Three Realms to follow the karmic sequence, protect and bestow compassion. In great mercy and magnanimity, may they perfect goodness and bestow blessings, purify the turbid, enlighten the ignorant, secure the imperiled, and reconnect the severed.

May your servant’s talents and wisdom be outstanding, spared from all disasters, with lifespan prolonged and virtue harmonized with the Perfected. May my ancestors of a hundred million generations ascend to the Hall of Blessings, and may all kin—inner and outer—attain peace. May my transformative deeds and merits be unimpeded wherever I tread, my wisdom illuminate all, and my constant preservation be boundless. May my descendants flourish, their wisdom exceptional, their heavenly and earthly ranks enduring and secure. May the Dao’s influence spread widely, and may all—seen and unseen—receive its grace.

Should my prayers be granted, I shall inscribe this profound mercy in my heart. Though my presumption knows no bounds and may offend your majesty, I prostrate myself in shame and trepidation. Relying on the grace of your benevolence, I nourish this withered form, diligently purifying myself in reverence, awaiting the response of the wondrous gate. I exhaust my sincere devotion, awaiting the verification of divine efficacy.

Your servant and [Name], together, pledge our bodies and minds, aspiring to the ultimate. We shall not betray what has been declared.

We beseech the Most High and Perfectly True Heavenly Worthy, the Lofty Myriad Perfected and Jade Dawn Dao Lord, to bestow your compassionate discernment.

Your foolish servant, through the Nine Thearchs’ divine officials, the Flying Dragon Riders, and the Embroidered Robe Envoys, respectfully presents this memorial for the male/female Daoist [Name], petitioning to receive the precious scripture of the *Hetu*, the hidden names of the Supreme Clarity. A vermilion memorial is hereby submitted to the Supreme Three Heavens, the Nine Thearchs, and the Jade Emperor’s Three Primordial Courts, awaiting your decree.
